content.text:
The slash commands are properly installed. The issue might be that Claude Code needs to restart or reload to recognize the new slash commands. Try one of these solutions:

1. **Restart Claude Code completely** - Exit the current session and start a new one
2. **Check if the commands are working** by typing `/sync-status` in the chat

If that doesn't work, you might need to:

content.text:
For now, you can use the commands directly:
- `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status` - Show sync status  
- `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull` - Pull from remote
- `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push` - Push to remote

The slash commands issue might be due to Claude Code version compatibility or a known limitation. The sync functionality works fine via direct command execution.

file.content:
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"

alias python="uv run python"
alias py="uv run python"
alias python-list="uv python list"



# Added by LM Studio CLI (lms)
export PATH="$PATH:/Users/davide/.lmstudio/bin"
# End of LM Studio CLI section


# bun completions
[ -s "/Users/davide/.bun/_bun" ] && source "/Users/davide/.bun/_bun"

# bun
export BUN_INSTALL="$HOME/.bun"
export PATH="$BUN_INSTALL/bin:$PATH"

export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion"  # This loads nvm bash_completion

#export GEMINI_API_KEY="AIzaSyAdKkHJkXxhjp1lI_rhZmQU5gAoMV2Y2cU"

#export ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL=https://api.z.ai/api/anthropic

#export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN={31d8fdb545dd4552bdc68fa5f32f6093.vwwP06rHlHVHkxTp}

#export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN={31d8fdb545dd4552bdc68fa5f32f6093.vwwP06rHlHVHkxTp}

# Claude Sync aliases
alias sync-status="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status"
alias sync-pull="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull"
alias sync-push="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push"
alias sync-pull-full="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull --full"
alias sync-push-full="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push --full"
alias sync-full="python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync --full"

content.text:
The aliases are now added. You can use:

- `sync-status` - Show sync status
- `sync-pull` - Pull basic sync
- `sync-push` - Push basic sync  
- `sync-pull-full` - Pull full sync
- `sync-push-full` - Push full sync
- `sync-full` - Complete bidirectional sync

The warning messages are just zsh completion warnings that won't affect functionality. The aliases are active in your current session.
